result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Ortiz

records.addlTxt:
8:21 AM Defendant Michael A Ortiz not in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty appeared by Zoom for Michael A Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Attorney Simon indicates he told the defendant he needed not to appear as he would be asking for an adjournment and anticipates it being a waiver. The Court will set this matter for a waiver of the preliminary hearing. Time limits were previously waived. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Letter requesting adjournment filed by Atty Simon**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 10/19 "Please confirm with the DA's office whether they are okay with changing the date to a prelim status hearing."

Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Generac listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
